duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform diversified clerical functions in Registration/Information, Appointments, Patient Care modules, Cashiering, and Medical Records.
Maintain the security and confidentiality of patient information at all times.
Greet and assist patients, family, and other individuals while maintaining excellent customer service at all times.
Perform electronic health record (eHR) competencies, including scanning insurance cards, capturing patient photos for the eHR, and facilitating patient flow.
Work in conjunction with the healthcare team, participating in site improvement efforts, accepting coverage assignments, and providing translation assistance.
Report problems with workflow, conflicts, further skill training, and other related concerns to supervisory staff.
Provide translation assistance as needed to facilitate patient and provider interaction.
Demonstrate awareness of and respect for coworkers/patients cultural backgrounds.

Perform registration functions, including visit registration, translation needs & documentation, verification of demographic information, verification of primary care provider, obtain consent for treatment, offer new patient packages, etc.
Perform financial functions, including insurance eligibility verification, collect co-pays and deductibles, determine eligibility for financial programs, and perform cashiering tasks.
Perform telephone functions, including answering phones, identifying the nature of the call, taking messages, and confirmation calls for upcoming appointments.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or equivalent required
